org.jscsi.target.scsi.sense
Class SenseData

java.lang.Object
  org.jscsi.target.scsi.sense.SenseData
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISerializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DescriptorFormatSenseData, FixedFormatSenseData
public abstract class SenseData
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISerializable

Sense data shall be returned in the same I_T_L_Q nexus transaction as a CHECK CONDITION status and as parameter data in response to the REQUEST SENSE command.

Sense data returned in the same I_T_L_Q nexus transaction as a CHECK CONDITION status shall be either fixed or descriptor format sense data format based on the value of the D_SENSE bit in the Control mode page.

The REQUEST SENSE command may be used to request either the fixed format sense data or the descriptor format sense data.

Author:
Andreas Ergenzinger

Field Detail

responseCode

protected final int responseCode
The first byte of all sense data contains the RESPONSE CODE field that indicates the error type and format of the sense data.

See Also:
errorType, senseDataFormat

errorType

protected final ErrorType errorType
The error type of the sense data as determined by the responseCode variable.

senseDataFormat

protected final SenseDataFormat senseDataFormat
The format of the sense data as determined by the responseCode variable.

senseKey

protected final SenseKey senseKey
The senseKey and additionalSenseCodeAndQualifier fields provide a hierarchy of information. The hierarchy provides a top-down approach for an application client to determine information relating to the error and exception conditions.

additionalSenseCodeAndQualifier

protected final AdditionalSenseCodeAndQualifier additionalSenseCodeAndQualifier
The senseKey and additionalSenseCodeAndQualifier fields provide a hierarchy of information. The hierarchy provides a top-down approach for an application client to determine information relating to the error and exception conditions.

SenseData

The sense data constructor.

Parameters:
errorType - the error type of the sense data
senseDataFormat - the format of the sense data
senseKey - describes the general category of the error requiring the sending of sense data
additionalSenseCodeAndQualifier - a more specific description of the error
